root.name: Tuneland
root.description: Tuneland is a musical children's game released in 1997 by a division of 7th Level, Kid's World Entertainment. The game follows young bear Little Howie (voiced by Howie Mandel) around Old McDonald's Farm, which consists of eight locations - the barnyard, farmhouse, barn, pond, grandma's house, train station, mountain and the valley.There are around 40 songs, most of which consist of nursery rhymes such as 'I'm A Little Teapot', 'Three Blind Mice' and 'Itsy Bitsy Spider'. Songs can be played back at any time by using the Jukebox in-game, and the actual game disc can be used as an audio CD.
